result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:32 PM Defendant Christopher J. Worden in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Christopher J. Worden.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Cherella makes a statement to the court as to the no contact order. 
Atty Sitzberger states they were not prepared for that motion today and does not have comments from the assigned ADA in this matter. 
Victim A makes a statement to the court. 
State does request the GPS monitor remain on and has no comment as to the no contact being changed to no violent contact.
Court will modify bond to no VIOLENT contact and defendant is not to reside at Woodland Park address and remove the GPS.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

dated 10-18-2022, filed by the State requesting that one or more victims have approval to appear via zoom for the hearing on 10-19-2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A and B/witness A/business listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A & B, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report to WCS by the end of business on 8/3/2022 for the GPS.    Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.  COURT ORDERED A $650.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $3,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND.  CASH BOND OF $650.00 POSTED ON 8/3/2022.
